cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 214 (Tuesday, January 2, 2024)][House][Pages H7027-H7028]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. TENNEY:H.R. 6910.[[Page H7028]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:Preventing foreign aid to Kosovo until they comply with the2013 Brussels Agreement

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

cdata.text:
Backing the Agreed-upon Compromises by Kosovo Imposed by the Negotiated Guarantees of the 2013 Brussels Agreement or the BACKING the 2013 Brussels Agreement Act

This bill limits U.S. assistance to Kosovo until certain conditions are met. Those conditions are

  • Kosovo implements the conditions required in the 2013 Brussels Agreement, including the creation of an association or Serb-majority municipalities;
  • special police are removed from northern Kosovo;
  • new mayoral elections are held in northern Kosovo;
  • the seizure of the private property of Serbs in Kosovo is halted; and
  • freedom of political expression is respected and upheld for all ethnicities in Kosovo.

The State Department shall report annually on the status of Kosovo Serbs and the progress made by Kosovo in meeting the conditions mentioned above. 

(The 2013 Brussels Agreement provided the first formal basis for normalized relations between Serbia and Kosovo.)

item.title: Backing the Agreed-upon Compromises by Kosovo Imposed by the Negotiated Guarantees of the 2013 Brussels Agreement
To prohibit United States assistance from being made available before the implementation of conditions under the 2013 Brussels Agreement, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
